note.p: Death: 'The Uplands', Great Shelford, near Cambridge, Cambridgeshire (07 September 1914)
Education: Highgate School (1855-1864); Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1869), MA; MD (Cantab)

Career: Studied mathematics, but gave it up in favour of medicine; Lecturer in Physiology, Cambridge University; Examiner in Physiology for the National Science Tripos; worked in the Physiological Laboratory, Cambridge; studied the heart and the nervous system; died of cerebral haemorrhage
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1914-1915 vol 88 pp xxvii-xxxvi signed by J N L
